alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Broward County; Metro Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Broward and south central Palm Beach Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 8 miles north of Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, or 19 miles northwest of Sunrise, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coral Springs, Weston, Parkland, Mission Bay, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, Miccosukee Service Plaza, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Miccosukee Indian Reservation, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Whisper Walk, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Loxahatchee NWR, West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley and South County Regional Park. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Florida.
